case_vignette: A 2-day-old female is noted to have a rash all over the body and distorted feet at birth. A 24 week ultrasound was remarkable for bilateral shortening of the long bones. Physical examination demonstrates light, fine yellow scales along curvilinear distribution on the chest, bilateral upper and lower extremities on background diffuse erythema. The bilateral feet are turned inward with plantar aspect almost sideways. An X-ray of the knees demonstrate focal dot-like calcifications in the epiphyses.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

trial_0.vignette_frq: Conradi-Hünermann syndrome (also known as chondrodysplasia punctata).

Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash all over my body and my feet are turned inward.
Have you experienced any joint pain or swelling along with the rash?
No, I have not experienced any joint pain or swelling along with the rash.
How long have you had the rash for?
I've had the rash since birth.
Does the rash itch or cause any discomfort?
No, the rash does not itch or cause any discomfort.
Do you have any known allergies or have you recently started any new medications?
No, I do not have any known allergies and I haven't started any new medications.
Does anyone in your family have a similar rash or any genetic disorders?
I am not aware of anyone in my family having a similar rash or any genetic disorders.
Have you noticed any changes in the appearance or spread of the rash over time?
No, there haven't been any changes in the appearance or spread of the rash over time.
Final Diagnosis: Epidermolytic ichthyosis.

I have a rash all over my body and my feet are turned inward.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
Since birth, so for 2 days now.
Was the pregnancy and delivery normal, or were there any complications/issues noted?
At 24 weeks of pregnancy, an ultrasound showed that the long bones in my arms and legs were shorter than usual.
Do you have any family history of genetic disorders or skeletal abnormalities?
I'm not aware of any family history of genetic disorders or skeletal abnormalities.
Final Diagnosis: Achondroplasia
